Dear Rhonda Ann Westphal:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• Repeat violations
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be completed
or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction;
Section prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Description (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth’s behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 6/16/23, youth and staff fell to the ground during a restraint.
While staff attempted to get up, youth grabbed and pulled staff
back down. For nine seconds, staff placed hand on youth’s face
and held youth down while attempting to stand. Staff was able to
separate from youth when an additional staff member arrived.
Youth then underwent a post restrained assessment by the
center’s nurse and complained of hip and shoulder pain, but no
observable injuries were reported in these locations. Youth’s
hands were observed to be swollen and when asked how the
swelling had occurred, youth reported that it was from hitting staff.
Investigation A complaint was received on 6/20/23 which alleged Youth A
began throwing chairs at Staff 1. Staff 1 properly restrained Youth
A but they fell to the ground. While Staff 1 attempted to get up
Youth A grabbed Staff 1 to pull him back down. For 9 seconds
Staff 1 placed his hand on Youth A’s face and held him down
while attempting to stand. Staff 1 was able to separate himself
from Youth A when an additional staff member arrived. Youth A
was assessed by the nurse and complained of hip and shoulder
pain, but no injuries were observed. Youth A’s hands were
swollen. Youth A stated the injury to his hands was from punching
Staff 1. Staff 1 was placed on administrative leave pending
investigation.
Interviews
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility concurrent with
the DHHS Worker. Youth A reported that earlier in the day he had
issues with Staff 1. Youth A stated Staff 1 always tries to talk to
Youth A even after Youth A asks him to stop. Staff 1 told Youth A
not to be disrespectful and called for runners. Youth A went into
his room for a personal time out. He was good until after lunch
when Staff 1 told him he lost his day, meaning he lost all of his
2

points due to his earlier behavior. Youth A became upset and
cussed at Staff 1. He was talking crap about Staff 1 and this was
making Staff 1 mad. Staff 1 told Youth A to say the right thing and
he would call for runners. Staff 1 asked Youth A why his mom did
not come visit him. Youth A and Staff 1 were going back and forth
verbally. Staff 1 then called for runners so Youth A picked up a
chair and threw it. Youth A then went to grab another chair. Staff 1
grabbed Youth A and threw him to the ground. Staff 1 put Youth A
in a headlock but it did not work and Youth A was able to get free
of the headlock. Staff 1 then held Youth A's head down. Staff 2
came and assisted. Staff 1 was putting so much pressure on his
face that it was scaring Youth A. Staff 1 got up then Youth A got
up and went to his room. Youth A was unsure where Staff 1's
other hand was while he was holding Youth A's face to the floor.
When the two of them went to the floor Staff 1's body landed on
top of Youth A. Youth A was hitting Staff 1 with a closed fist as
they were on the ground. Youth A said he has told people he does
not like Staff 1. Youth A reported that staff are supposed to
release them once they end up on the ground during a restraint.
Staff 1 was not supposed to put him in a headlock. Youth A said
his side hurt from landing on it when they went to the ground. He
also had bruises on his right upper arm. Youth A stated during the
time he was on the floor someone was trying to put his arm back
behind him but he did not know who that was. All he could see
was Staff 1. Other kids on his unit witnessed the incident. He has
not seen Staff 1 since the incident occurred.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on 6/26/23.
Youth B reported he was present for the incident between Youth A
and Staff 1. He said Youth A and Staff 1 were verbally going back
and forth. Staff 1 said he was going to call for runners which
means to call staff in case a restraint needs to happen. Staff 1
called for runners and Youth A threw a chair at Staff 1. Youth A
then tried to throw another chair but Staff 1 slammed Youth A onto
the floor, put him in a headlock, and pressed his head into the
floor. Youth B said he was right there when this happened and
could see everything. Youth A did fight back by hitting Staff 1.
Another staff came in and the youth were told to line up in the
hallway. More staff came in as the youth were lining up. Youth B
stated he has not been restrained while at the facility. He has
seen many other restraints, and this was not a normal restraint.
Youth A could not remember what was said between Staff 1 and
Youth A. He just knew that the two of them were arguing back and
forth. Youth B said he thought Staff 1 was going to do anything he
could to get into a fight with Youth A. Youth B said Staff 1 is petty.
Staff 1 would tell the youth that is why they could not go home.
3

When another youth said that Staff 1 was not supposed to say
that Staff 1 would deduct points from that youth. Youth B did
remember Youth A asking Staff 1 to stop talking but Staff 1 kept
talking.
All staff interviewed had legal representation from the county
counsel present as well as the DHHS Worker.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 6/26/23. Staff
3 stated he is a shift supervisor who was on during the incident
between Youth A and Staff 1. He stated he responded to the unit
due to an assistance call. When he got to the unit, he saw Staff 2
and Staff 4 releasing Youth A and Staff 1 was standing up. He did
not see the incident until he watched the video. Staff 3 said he
reviewed the video then called the Chief Administrator (CA) and
reported his concerns. He stated his concerns were that the
restraint technique was not utilized properly, and that Staff 1 had
his hand on Youth A's head. He stated he is a trainer for their
restraint technique, MACH, and the only hold they utilize is a
standing hold. If a youth were to drop to the floor while in that
hold, they are to disengage. They do help guide the youth to the
floor, so they do not hurt themselves but then they disengage.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 6/26/23. He
reported Youth A was saying awful things to him and made a
threat that the next time Staff 1 showed up at his door Youth A
would assault Staff 1. Staff 1 called for runners then Youth A
picked up a chair and threw it. Youth A went to pick up another
chair and went after Staff 1 with it. Staff 1 then went into a
physical restraint. Staff 1 said he utilized MACH to try and restrain
Youth A. Staff 1 tried to go into a restraint. Staff 1 said he lost his
footing and they went to the ground. Staff 2 was also there and
involved in the physical management. Youth A was punching Staff
1 resulting in injuries to Staff 1's chest and knees. Staff 1 reported
he did not seek medical attention for his injuries. Staff 1 said he
was trying to get up off the floor any way he could thus he had his
hand on Youth A's face. When he got up, Youth A told Staff 1 that
he beat his ass. Other staff came in and Staff 1 asked to go for a
walk before returning to the unit. He was then moved to work in
central control to monitor the cameras and doors. The next day
when he came into work he was again placed in Central Control
for a couple of hours. When CA came in, he was placed on leave.
Staff 1 reported he has had to physically manage Youth A before.
Youth A did tell Staff 1 he did not want to talk to him so Staff 1 told
Youth A he would not earn his points. Staff 1 said he tried verbally
de-escalating Youth A by telling him that his behavior was not
4

helping him do better. He encouraged him by telling Youth A that
he had turned his day around. Staff 1 said he has had restraint
training within the last 6 months. He is certified in physical
restraints yearly. Staff 1 said he called for assistance because
Youth A made a threat of violence.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 6/26/23. Staff
4 stated he was in central control when a call for assistance or a
call for runners was made. He saw on camera that Youth A had
thrown a chair at Staff 1. Staff 4 left and went to get a radio and
when he returned, he saw Youth A on the floor so he went to the
unit. Staff 4 thought maybe Youth A had a weapon, and this was
the reason they were on the floor otherwise there was no reason
for them to be on the floor. Once on the unit he saw 2 staff on the
ground with Youth A. He could not recall the 2 staff who were on
the floor with Youth A. He stated what he saw on video was a
female staff, whose name he could not recall, and Staff 1 were
going to the ground when he looked up at the monitor. Staff 4 said
to him it looked like Staff 1 tackled Youth A. Staff 4 could not recall
anything that was said when he got to the unit. Staff 4 reported
when the youth go to the ground in a restraint the staff are
supposed to let the youth back up. Staff 4 could not recall how
Staff 1 was positioned when he got to the unit. He did not know
what was keeping Youth A on the ground. He was unsure if Staff 2
was holding Youth A down. Staff 4 was not sure of any history
between Youth A and Staff 1. He stated Youth A was upset earlier
in the day about his medication. Staff 4 did not know what forced
the two to the ground but it could have been an uncontrolled fall.
Staff 5 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 6/26/23. He
reported he responded to a call for runners. Youth A was on the
floor with Staff 1 and Staff 2 trying to get Youth A off the floor.
Staff 5 said he got to the unit at the end of the incident. He stated
staff were holding Youth A's arms in order to help him up. He
could not recall who was holding which arm. He heard Youth A
say "I do this shit. I beat your ass." Two weeks prior Youth A and
Staff 1 had issues with each other. Staff 5 was surprised Staff 1
was working with Youth A. Youth A told Staff 5 that Staff 1 picks
on him. He could not recall what happened two weeks prior.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 6/26/23. Staff
2 stated Staff 1 called for assistance. When she got to the unit the
other youth on the unit were at the table and she told them to line
up. Staff 1 and Youth A were on the ground. She was trying to get
them separated as it was no longer about a restraint. Both were
angry. She got on the floor with them. Youth A was on the bottom
5

and Staff 1 was over top of him. She did not hear them say
anything. Youth A was punching Staff 1 while they were on the
ground. Staff 1 was trying to grab Youth A's wrist to get him to
stop. She was at Youth A's back and Staff 1 pressed Youth A's
head to the ground. She was telling Youth A to stop. She never
told Staff 1 to stop. Staff 1 was supposed to let go of Youth A once
he was on the floor, but he didn't. Everyone else came on the unit.
She held onto Youth A's ankles and Staff 4 held Youth A's arms.
Staff 6 told them to let Youth A up. Youth A got up and walked to
his room. Staff 2 reported they are taught not to engage in a
restraint until another staff is present to help. Staff 2 said she
knew Staff 1 was angry because of his facial expression. She said
Staff 1 pressing Youth A's face down was forceful. Staff 1 did this
for a few moments prior to getting up from the floor using Youth
A's face to push up off the floor.
Staff 6 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 6/26/23. Staff
6 said she is the shift supervisor. She received a runners call at
first then 5 seconds later it was an assistance call meaning
everybody needed to go to the unit. Staff 1 was on the floor with
Youth A, so she directed him to get up and let Youth A go. She
got in between Youth A and Staff 1. She stated if a restraint goes
to the floor, they tell staff to let the youth up. She was unsure how
Youth A was being held. Staff 6 saw the video and she had
concerns stating "that is not what we do here." Youth A was not
put in a MACH hold and they never went to a MACH hold. She
stated initial contact was Youth A being slammed in a wrestling
move to the ground. Staff 1 had his arm around Youth A's upper
shoulder. When Youth A was on the ground Staff 1 had his hand
on Youth A's head. She did not see this prior to watching the
video. Staff 6 debriefed with Youth A who told her Staff 1 said he
would be thinking of Youth A when he was at home eating his
steak. Youth A also told her Staff 1 called for runners for no
reason. She reported Youth A did not have any injuries, but he did
see the nurse.
Youth C was interviewed face to face by the DHHS Worker at his
home on 7/6/23. This consultant participated by phone. Youth C
said he was present for the incident between Youth A and Staff 1.
Youth A was talking “crap” to Staff 1 and antagonizing him. He did
not hear what Staff 1 said. Staff 1 called for runners and Youth A
threw a chair at him. Staff 1 tackled Youth A to the ground. Youth
C reported this was the only time he ever saw a youth get tackled.
Youth C said he did not see anything else as they were told to go
outside the unit as they are supposed to do when an incident
6

occurs. He did not see or hear anything else. Youth C said Youth
A and Staff 1 never got along.
Video
Video of the incident was reviewed. Video starts at 1:19pm. Youth
A is seated at a table by himself. Other youth are sitting at a table
on the opposite side of the room. Staff 1 is seated in a chair a few
feet from the table Youth A is at. The two appear to be talking but
there is no sound on the video. Youth A and Staff 1 both stand up.
Staff 1 moves toward Youth A. Youth A takes his chair and throws
it at Staff 1. The chair hits Staff 1 as he moves toward Youth A.
Youth A then goes for another chair but before it can be thrown at
Staff 1 it is deflected by Staff 1. Staff 1 runs up on Youth A, wraps
his arms around his upper shoulders and slams Youth A onto the
floor. Staff 1 ends up over top of Youth A as Youth A is on his
side. Youth A hits and kicks Staff 1. Staff 2 enters and tries to pull
Youth A away from Staff 1. Staff 1 tries to stand but is pulled back
down by Youth A. Staff 1 lands on his side then turns over and
places his hand on Youth A’s head pressing it to the floor. After a
few seconds Staff 1 then gets up and moves away from Youth A
as other staff come in and work to release Youth A from the hold.
Documentation Reviewed
• Incident Report: Dated 6/16/23 at 1:26pm written by Staff 1.
Youth A made a threat that the next time Staff 1 came to
his door with a food cart Youth A would attack him.
Runners/Shift Supervisor was requested. Staff 1 instructed
the other youth to line up, Youth A picked up a chair and
threw it at Staff 1. Youth A then picked up another chair
and raised the chair to hit Staff 1 a second time. Staff 1
began a physical management for the protection of himself
and the other youth. Staff 1 lost his footing and the two of
them fell to the floor. Staff 2 attempted to help with the
physical management. Youth A punched Staff 1 multiple
times in his chest. Staff 1 made attempts to get back on his
feet. Once Staff 1 was on his feet he heard Youth A yell
that he kicked Staff 1's ass. Youth A went to his room and
Staff 1 asked to take a walk.
• Nurses Note: Dated 6/16/23 stated Youth A was assessed
after a physical management. Youth A said that he was
slammed to the ground and that he has a slight pain on his
right hip and right shoulder. There was not any swelling or
bruising and no sign of injury was found on his hip or
shoulder. Youth A said the right side of his head hit the
floor and that his head was held down on the floor. Youth
A's head was checked and there was no sign of injury.
7

Youth A also said his right hand was swollen from hitting
staff. The nurse found that Youth A's hand was swollen so
ice was applied. Youth A refused any pain medication.
• Youth A case file: Youth A was admitted to the facility on
5/5/23 for domestic violence charges. He has a history of
defiance, aggression, and running away.
• Staff 1 employee file: Staff 1 was written up in 2021 and
was suspended for an inappropriate comment he made to
youth. Other disciplines were for attendance. Staff 1 has
been working at the facility since 9/13/10. Staff 1 was last
trained in restraints on 3/22/23 and verbal de-escalation on
2/8/23.
• Resident Management Policy: Staff restraining youth are
only allowed to utilize techniques taught by MACH, the
facility’s restraint training.
• MACH Training Videos: none of the holds taught by MACH
match the hold conducted by Staff 1.
Analysis Based on interviews with staff and youth and review of video Staff
1 slammed Youth A onto the floor and pressed his face into the
floor. Because of this Staff 1 did not conduct a safe appropriate
restraint on Youth A.
Technical Assistance:
The facility’s Resident Management Policy should be updated so it
is in line with the current rules.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR 2023C0000221 dated 3/6/23; CAP approved 4/10/23
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications.
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff 1 does not have the ability to perform the duties of his
position.
Investigation In the above investigation Youth reported Staff 1 slammed him on
the floor and pressed his head to the floor.
The video of the incident as well as interviews with other staff and
youth found Staff 1 did slam Youth A onto the floor and pressed
his head to the floor.
8

A case conference held with the DHHS Worker on 7/17/23 found
that Staff 1 was being confirmed for improper supervision due to
his actions during this incident.
Analysis Because of the information gathered from interviews and video
footage showing Staff 1 conducting an unsafe and inappropriate
restraint as well as being confirmed for improper supervision Staff
1 does not have the ability to perform his duties.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR 2023C0000221 dated 3/6/23; CAP approved 4/10/23
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan it is recommended that the
license of this CCI be unchanged.
